intro: Melicope petiolaris, commonly known as Hawaiian mahogany, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish-brown bark and dark green, leathery leaves. It produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Melicope petiolaris is often found in coastal and lowland forests, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
